III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth reports being assaulted by 4 different staff members 2
years ago at the facility. Some of the staff members were not
employed at this time.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via
phone on 11/20/23 and face to face at the facility on 11/21/23.
CA reported Youth A AWOLs from the facility every day or every
other day. When law enforcement responded to the AWOL the
other day, Youth A told law enforcement he was assaulted by four
staff 2 years ago. CA noted Youth A did not provide any details of
how staff assaulted him, when they assaulted him or where they
assaulted him. CA reported there are video cameras at the facility,
but they only store information for the past 30 days, so there are
no videos to review.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/21/23. Youth A reported in January 2023, he tried to AWOL,
but he was stopped by Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1 stood
behind him and choked him by putting his arm around Youth A’s
neck. Youth A reported he told Staff 1 to let go and Staff 1 did
after about 30 seconds. Youth A reported there was no one else
around during the incident, but he reported the incident to
Therapist and Supervisor 2 after it happened. Youth A reported
another time he was trying to AWOL by the main office when Staff
2 and Supervisor 1 started punching him. Youth A reported there
were other staff around witnessing the incident, but he couldn’t
provide any names because it was a long time ago. Youth A
reported he couldn’t remember when the incident occurred, but he
thinks it was during the winter. Youth A could not remember how
many times they punched him or where they punched him on his
body. Youth A reported after they punched him, they put him on
his back on the ground and held his arms and legs down with their
arms and legs. Youth A reported they restrained him on the
ground on his back for about an hour, and only let go because the
police came. Youth A reported he told the police what happened,
and they took him to the hospital. Youth A reported he didn’t tell
anyone about the incident because there were so many staff who
2

saw it and didn’t do anything about it. Youth A reported
Administrator was never involved in any assaults against him.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/21/23. Therapist reported Youth A never told him about staff
assaulting him by choking him, punching him, or anything else.
Therapist reported there was a situation last time Youth A was at
the facility where Youth A punched Supervisor 1, but he wasn’t
present at the time and only heard about the situation from other
staff.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/21/23. Supervisor 1 reported he has never punched Youth A.
Supervisor 1 reported there was a time last winter where Youth A
was trying to come in the building after being AWOL and Staff 2
was trying to search him before he came in the building, but Youth
A wasn’t cooperating. Supervisor 1 reported he was called for
assistance and when he arrived, Youth A was punching Staff 2.
Supervisor 1 reported he used TCI restraint method to intervene
and when he pulled Youth A away, Youth A turned around and
punched Supervisor 1 in the face. Supervisor 1 reported he
pursued criminal charges against Youth A because Supervisor 1’s
lip was busted, and his eye was in bad shape. Supervisor 1
reported after he was punched by Youth A, he and Staff 2 put
Youth A in a two-person ground restraint using TCI and held him
there for about 5-10 minutes until the police arrived. Supervisor 1
reported Youth A was taken to Wayne Juvenile Detention Facility.
Supervisor 1 reported Supervisor 2 was present for the situation
and viewed the restraint. Supervisor 1 reported he never punched
Youth A or was violent with him. Supervisor 1 reported he never
saw Staff 2 punch Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported there was an
incident report written about the situation.
Supervisor 2 no longer works at the facility. An attempt was
made to contact her last known phone number, but it is now
the number to a catering service. Therefore, Supervisor 2 was
unable to be interviewed.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 11/30/23. Staff 1 reported
he no longer works at the facility. Staff 1 reported there was a
situation in which Youth A was trying to go AWOL, so Staff 1
stood in front of the door to prevent him from leaving. Staff 1
reported he never choked Youth A. Staff 1 reported he held his
hands up and said, “stay back”, but then had to leave to address
another situation. Staff 1 reported when he came back, Youth A
3

had exited the building. Staff 1 reported he has never seen any
staff assault Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 11/27/23. Staff 2 reported
he no longer works at the facility. Staff 2 reported last winter,
Youth A was trying to go AWOL, and he was acting very irrational.
Staff 2 reported he participated in restraining Youth A where he
was restraining Youth A’s legs and Supervisor 1, and Supervisor 3
were holding Youth A’s arms. Staff 2 reported the restraint was
done appropriately per TCI. Staff 2 reported he has never
assaulted or punched Youth A and he has never seen any other
staff or supervisors assault Youth A.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Youth A’s placement history at the facility includes the
following dates: 5/17/22-6/10/22, 6/11/22-6/14/22, 12/2/22-
1/6/23, 11/14/23-11/19/23, and 11/20/23-11/22/23.
• Reviewed special investigation allegations for the facility
from May 2022-Present. Youth A has never alleged
concerns about staff from the facility assaulting him
previously.
• MiSACWIS Incident Report #146590197 dated 12/23/22
states Youth A returned from AWOL, so Staff 1 opened the
door and searched Youth A. Youth A wouldn’t comply with
instructions of where to put his shoes, and proceeded to
walk up the stairs where his group resides. Staff 1 followed
Youth A and continued to ask for his coat and shoes per
Youth A’s AWOL safety plan, but Youth A continued to
refuse and tried to push past Staff 1 to leave the building
again. Staff 1 stood in front of the doorway and continued
to provide instructions to Youth A. Youth A became more
upset and threw hygiene products all over his room. Youth
A tried to tear the gate from his window, so Staff 1 stood in
front of the window. Youth A pulled the pole from the wall,
which had electrical wires in it. Staff 1 placed Youth A in a
small child restraint. Staff 1 redirected Youth A. Youth A
eventually relaxed and gave Staff 1 his shoes and coat.
Restraint lasted 5 minutes.
• MiSACWIS Incident Report #147220196 dated 1/6/23
states Youth A returned from AWOL and was refusing to be
searched. Staff 2 and Supervisor 1 both requested he
comply, but he began to call staff explicit names and
demanded to be let into the building. Staff 2 and Supervisor
4

1 refused and requested he take of the ski mask he was
wearing and asked him to calm down. Staff 2 and
Supervisor 1 noticed a bulge in Youth A’s pants and asked
Supervisor 2 to call the police to have them search Youth
A. Youth A attempted to run into the office, pushed Staff 2
and was calling Staff 2 and Supervisor 1 explicit names.
Staff 2 continued to push Staff 2 while Staff 2 was in a
protective stance. Supervisor 1 signaled to Staff 2 to
prepare for a standing hold, and Youth A punched
Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 put Youth A into a
standing hold. Youth A punched Staff 2 in the chest and
Supervisor 1 in his left eye. Supervisor 2 called for
Supervisor 3 to report so he could assist in a 3-man supine
restraint. When he arrived, they completed the restraint for
approximately 7 minutes before police arrived. Youth A was
put into handcuffs by police and taken outside for medical
observation with EMS. Youth A was then taken to the
hospital.
• Detroit Police Department Report #230106-0334 dated
1/6/23 states Youth A became very upset and began to hit
Supervisor 1 on the side of his face with a closed fist.
Supervisor 1 and Staff 2 attempted to hold Youth A on the
ground. While on the ground, Youth A began to hit Staff 2
in the chest with a closed fist and spit on both Staff 2 and
Supervisor 1. Youth A told officers Supervisor 1 punched
him on the right side of his face and rammed his head
against the wall, so Youth A was taken to the hospital for a
possible head injury.
• MiSACWIS Incident Report #147210196 dated 1/6/23
states Youth A wanted to go AWOL and was asked several
times to sit down and relax. Youth A appeared high off
drugs and could not stop pacing. Youth A tried to push past
staff but could not go past due to staff using a TCI
protective stance. Youth A climbed on the table and tried to
pull down the pipes. Youth A was asked to get down
several times to prevent him from harming himself. Youth A
got down and began destroying the TV, which was
removed. Youth A then started to destroy and break the
window. Staff intervened and directed him away from the
window. Youth A began pushing on staff aggressively.
Youth A was placed into a standing hold and then a 3-man
team restraint by Staff 2, Supervisor 1, and Supervisor 3.
Restraint lasted 5 minutes.
5

• Policy for TCI in Residential Programs outlines the use of
non-violent physical restrictions to be used. They should
never be used as a form of punishment, discipline, ensuring
compliance, demonstrating authority or retaliation. They
should be utilized as a physical control for any behavior
that is likely to result in physical injury or imminent risk of
physical harm of the client, other clients, staff members or
others.
• TCI Manual Module 6 regarding safety interventions details
the non-violent physical restrictions with pictures. Standing
two-man restraint and three-man supine restraint were
approved methods for restraint. TCI does not allow
punching, hitting, or choking.
• Staff 1 has eight disciplinary records in his employee file,
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 completed Behavior
Management Training on 2/22/22. Staff 1 completed TCI
Physical Intervention training 11/2/21, 3/22/22 and 6/14/22.
Staff 1 resigned from the facility effective 4/28/23.
• Staff 2 has three disciplinary records in his employee file,
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 2 also has a
termination record in his employee file for conducting an
improper CPI restraint, unrelated to this investigation. Staff
2 was terminated effective 11/15/23. Staff 2 was trained in
TCI on 6/12/22.
• Supervisor 1 does not have any disciplinary records in his
employee file. Supervisor 1 completed TCI training on
4/6/21, 11/2/21, 3/22/22 and 6/14/22.
• Supervisor 2 has three disciplinary records in her employee
file, unrelated to this investigation. Supervisor 2 also has a
termination record in her employee file unrelated to this
investigation. Supervisor 2 was terminated effective
11/7/23. Supervisor 2 completed TCI training on 4/5/22 and
6/14/22.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, this
violation is not established. There is no evidence to support Staff
1, Staff 2, or Supervisor 1 assaulted Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
